required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A New Revolutionary 3-Injection- Protocol in Infertile Women
clinical_study.official_title: A New Revolutionary 3-Injection- Protocol in Infertile Women With a Single Long Acting GnRH Antagonist in the Luteal Phase, a Bolus Gonadotropin Injection in the Early Follicular Phase and a Single Triggering Dose.

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective randomised study of the evaluation of the clinical IVF results after following a new revolutionary 3-Injection- Protocol for controlled ovarian stimulation in infertile women.

detailed_description.textblock:
A randomized prospective study focusing on infertile women undergoing ovarian stimulation for IVF, using Elonva (corifollitropin alfa) as part of two different stimulation protocols.
Women assigned to Protocol A receive a bolus late luteal dose of Degarelix, a new long acting GnRH antagonist, a sole Elonva injection in the evening of day 3 of the cycle, followed by the administration of a single dose of triggering agent (GnRH agonist or hCG a, according to the individual response).
Women assigned to Protocol B are administered a single dose of Elonva (corifollitropin alfa) on day 2 of the cycle, followed by daily GnRH antagonist doses, fixed on day 7 of the cycle. Ovulation triggering is the same as in group A, with either GnRH agonist or hCG a, accordingly.
Live Birth Rates are estimated for both groups of patients. The number of the formed blastocysts in each group is measured, as well.

primary_outcome.measure: Live birth rate according to stimulation protocol
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 38 weeks after embryo transfer
primary_outcome.description: Live birth rate according to stimulation protocol

secondary_outcome.measure: Blastulation rate according to stimulation protocol
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 days post oocyte retrieval
secondary_outcome.description: Blastulation rate according to stimulation protocol

arm_group.description: Women in group A (3-Injection-Protocol Group) receive a bolus late luteal dose of Degarelix, a new long acting GnRH antagonist, a sole Elonva injection in the early follicular phase followed by the administration of a single dose of triggering agent (GnRH agonist or hCG a, according to the individual response).

Women assigned to group B (Multiple- Injection- Protocol Group) are administered a single dose of Elonva (corifollitropin alfa) in the early follicular phase followed by daily GnRH antagonist doses, either fixed on day 6 of the stimulation cycle, or when 2 or 3 follicles over 12-14 mm are present. Ovulation triggering is the same as in group A, with either GnRH agonist or hCG a, accordingly.

intervention.description: Live Birth Rate and Blastulation Rate according to the protocol of COS

study_pop.textblock: Women aged 22- 39, faced with infertility issues, meeting the above inclusion criteria.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- primary infertility
- age 22-39 years;
- body mass index (BMI) 18-29kg/m2;
- regular menstrual cycle of 26-35 days,
- presumed to be ovulatory;
- early follicular- phase serum concentration of FSH within normal limits (1-12 IU/l).
Exclusion Criteria:
- women with diabetes and other metabolic disease
- women with heart disease, QT prolongation, heart failure
- elevated liver enzymes, liver failure, hepatitis
- women with inflammatory or autoimmune disease
- abnormal karyotype
- polycystic ovarian syndrome
- endometriosis stage III/IV

responsible_party.investigator_title: Papanikolaou Evaggelos, MD, PhD, Fertility Specialist, Scientific Director at Assisting Nature IVF Clinic
